overview: The purpose of this Act is to establish a three-year women's court pilot program in the circuit court of the second and fifth circuits, which is intended to acknowledge the distinct pathways that lead women into the criminal justice system and address their individualized needs. [3] This Act also requires the third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3]
appropriations: An appropriation has been inserted for the Department of Health for the women's court pilot program, including the establishment of positions. [4] The Committee on Finance is requested to consider an appropriation amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health. [4] This includes $145,000 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary clinical psychologist position, $76,788 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social worker/human services professional IV position, and $45,216 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) for one full-time equivalent (1.0 FTE) temporary social services assistant V position. [4]
assumptions_and_methodology: The Department of Health requests a budget of $801,802 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), which is based on the Department’s staffing requirements for the operation of the existing Women’s Court pilot project of the First Circuit. [2] The Judiciary submitted testimony that the circuit courts on the Big Island are unable to manage another stand-alone specialty treatment court as represented by the template of the successful First Circuit program. [2] In the alternative, the Legislature could direct the Third Circuit and the BIDC to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for the program and set forth the resource requirements, to be submitted for the next legislative session. [2]
agency_impact: The amended measure requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to study and submit a report on establishing a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [4] There is now an appropriation for the Department of Health for the women's court pilot program, and the sums appropriated shall be expended by the department of health for the purposes of this Act. [3] The Department of Health will be responsible for a clinical psychologist position, a social worker/human services professional IV position, and a social services assistant V position. [3]
policy_impact: This measure was amended by deleting language that would have established a three-year women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit of the Judiciary. [4] It now requires the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court to conduct an interim study to establish a blueprint for a women's court pilot program in the third circuit. [3] The effective date was changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
six_year_fiscal_implications: The Committee on Judiciary & Hawaiian Affairs respectfully requests the Committee on Finance to consider establishing seven temporary positions in the Judiciary and an appropriation amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt) to the Department of Health. [4] The DOH's requested budget is based on the First Circuit's pilot project, which requires a 1.0 FTE Clinical Psychologist at $145,000 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), a 1.0 FTE Social Worker/Human Services Professional IV at $76,788 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt), and a 1.0 FTE Social Services Assistant V at $45,216 (HB727_TESTIMONY_JHA_01-30-25_.PDF.txt) for each circuit. [2] [2] The bill appropriates an unspecified sum out of the general revenues of the State of Hawaii for fiscal year 2025-2026 and the same sum for fiscal year 2026-2027 to be expended by the Department of Health for those positions. [3] [3] A separate, unspecified appropriation for the same fiscal years is made to the judiciary for equipment, mental health and substance abuse treatment services, and an unspecified number of temporary positions. [3] [3] The number of temporary staff positions established in the Judiciary was changed to an unspecified amount. [4] The third circuit of the judiciary and big island drug court shall conduct an interim study and submit a report of its findings and recommendations, including any proposed legislation and resource requirements, to the legislature prior to the convening of the regular session of 2026. [3] [3]
updates_from_previous_fiscal_note: The bill was amended to establish the three-year women's court pilot program in the Second and Fifth Circuits, removing the Third Circuit from the pilot. [4] Instead, the Third Circuit of the Judiciary and Big Island Drug Court are required to study and submit a report on establishing a women's court pilot program in the Third Circuit. [4] An appropriation for the Department of Health was inserted for the pilot program, with the committee requesting a specific amount of $801,802 (HB727_HD1_HSCR624_.htm.txt). [4] The number of temporary staff positions to be established in the Judiciary was changed from seven to an unspecified amount. [4] Finally, the measure's effective date was changed to July 1, 3000, to encourage further discussion. [4]
